Data Structures | Macros
FIFO Buffer
Stratify OS » Device Interface
Collaboration diagram for FIFO Buffer:

Detailed Description

This device is a FIFO RAM buffer. A write to the buffer adds data to the FIFO. A read from the buffer reads from the FIFO. If the FIFO fills up, additional writes will block until data arrives. Similarly, if the FIFO is empty, a read will block until data arrives.

#define I_FIFO_GETATTR
 See below. More...
 
#define I_FIFO_FLUSH
 This request flushes all data out of the fifo (third ioctl() arg is omitted).
 
#define I_FIFO_INIT
 This request initializes the fifo (third ioctl() arg is omitted).
 
#define I_FIFO_EXIT
 This request shuts down the operation of the FIFO.
 
#define I_FIFO_SETWRITEBLOCK
 This request tells the FIFO whether or not to block when data is written and the buffer is full. More...
 
#define I_FIFO_PEEK
 Request a peek at the data in the FIFO. More...
 

Macro Definition Documentation

#define FIFO_DEVICE (   device_name,
  cfg_ptr,
  state_ptr,
  mode_value,
  uid_value,
  gid_value 
)

This defines the configuration values for a FIFO device.

Parameters
device_nameThe name of the device (e.g "fifo0")
cfg_ptrA pointer to the const fifo_cfg_t data structure
state_ptrA pointer to the state structure (see fifo_state_t)
mode_valueThe access mode (usually 0666)
uid_valueThe User ID
gid_valueThe Group ID

Example:

1 #include <hwdl/fifo.h>
2 const fifo_cfg_t fifo_cfg0 = { .buffer = fifo_buf0, .size = FIFO_BUF_SIZE };
3 fifo_state_t fifo_state0;
4 const device_t devices[DEVICES_TOTAL+1] = {
5  ...
6  FIFO_DEVICE("fifo0", &fifo_cfg0, &fifo_state0, 0666, USER_ROOT, GROUP_ROOT),
7  ...
8  DEVICE_TERMINATOR
9 }
#define I_FIFO_GETATTR

This request gets the size of the FIFO in bytes. Example:

1 fifo_attr_t attr;
2 ioctl(fifo_fd, I_FIFO_GETATTR, &attr);
#define I_FIFO_PEEK

This request allows a process to peek at the data in the FIFO without reading it.

1 char buffer[16];
2 fifo_peek_t peek_req;
3 peek_req.buf = buffer; //Destination buffer
4 peek_req.loc = 0; //first available bytes in FIFO
5 peek_req.nbyte = 16; //peek up to 16 bytes
6 ioctl(fifo_fd, I_FIFO_PEEK, &peek);
#define I_FIFO_SETWRITEBLOCK
